newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Forest fire rages near Jerusalem.
newsitem.headline: Forest fire rages near Jerusalem.

text.p: A forest fire raged in the foothills of Jerusalem on Friday, forcing the evacuation of three villages but causing no serious injuries, police said.
Flames whipped by high winds reached within 100 metres (yards) of the main Tel Aviv-Jerusalem highway.
A police spokesman said 11 people were treated for smoke inhalation and helicopters and planes dropped water on the blaze. Dozens of fire engines and ambulances were at the scene.

Police ordered the evacuation of the Jerusalem suburb of Mevasseret Zion and two agricultural villages, Kiryat Anavim and Beit Nakofa. The spokesman said several buildings in Kiryat Anavim, a kibbutz, were destroyed by the fire.
The blaze, whose cause police said was still unknown, erupted about eight km (five miles) west of Jerusalem.
A little more than a year ago, a fire devastated pine forests along the western approaches to the city.
